data.title: Eh
data.text: Stopped in for lunch. I ordered the 2 meat plate which includes a scoop of Mac salad and 2 scoops of rice.  The meats that I chose were Kailua pig and BBQ teriyaki chicken.  The BBQ chicken was fine. It came with a large portion.  However the Kailua pig was more mushy than anything.  It didn't have much flavor. I was hoping to find another hole in the wall gem, but just found another average lunch stop.

data.title: Great food
data.text: Wow what a great surprise this place is!  They have great food.  The presentation is good.  Dine in or take out!  I can't decide what I like best but have been back twice in the last week after trying it.  Pricing is great, food is great, service was great!

data.title: Better than Da Kitchen in Maui (Serious)
data.text: I recently got back from Maui with my family. In Kahului is an authentic Hawaiian food restaurant called Da Kitchen. It's rated #1 out of 99 restaurants on Maui by TripAdvisor, and rightly so. As far as authentic Hawaiian food goes, it was the best I'd ever eaten... until now. Right here in my backyard is Island Grinds, a little "hole-in-the-wall" restaurant serving the best Hawaiian food ever, even compared to the #1 restaurant in Maui. Even as I'm writing this I'm dying to run over there, knowing I would be personally torn between the Pupu Chicken and the Short Ribs, but happy either way knowing I'll add plenty of the best teriyaki sauce. BONUS: The macaroni salad that comes with your order is awesome, too.

data.title: If I could give it more stars, I would.
data.text: Everything was excellent. I got the two meat plate with pupu chicken and the BBQ teri chicken. Both so tender and juicy each bringing a unique and delicious flavor to my mouth. My wife got the katsu chicken and she loved it as well. If you are thinking that this is similar to L&L or Honolulu grill you are wrong. This place is 100x better, the macaroni here is flavorful and the rice comes out nice and warm. I recommend putting their teri sauce on it. Mmm. I'm so glad my wife and I happened upon this place. No complaints. 10/5 stars. We will be recommending this place to family and friends.

data.title: What a delightful surprise!
data.text: Authentic Hawaiian food, good price. The pupu chicken is awesome and so is the macaroni salad. The "combo" is perfect for kids. It's a non-profit for a good cause too. Can't beat that. We will be back!

data.title: pretty good but a lot of room for improvement
data.text: They have a sign in their window claiming to be "world famous" like several other establishments in St. George that are unknown to everybody but locals. That means to me that they have a very high opinion (deserved or not) of their food. Tried  the lunch special. For only $5.00 I got a deep fried boneless chicken thigh which had crispy skin and no breading (that is a good feature to me), an ice cream scoop of macaroni salad that was overdressed (not as much so as one usually finds in area) but one of the better ones we have found, an ice cream scoop of rice that was terrible. Usually you can put a fork into rice and it crumbles but this was so sticky and dry that a chunk would break off without breaking into grains. Finally it came with a drink. a good deal for the price but somebody needs to do something about the rice. The place was almost empty when we arrived but filled up while we were there. Many customers looked like Tongan or Samoan natives which speaks well for the food usually. Like the islands where the only change expected for the day is the tide and it takes all day, the pace of service is also laid back. Don't expect fast food. I probably will not drive across town to eat here again but if I find myself in the area, I definitely would. Lots of food for the price, clean and new facility and food (other than the rice) was pretty good.

data.title: Yummy
data.text: Just a note to start with.  They moved,  there  new location is in Sunset Plaza,  on  the  corner of Sunset blvd.  &  Dixie Drive.  The  food is very good, and plenty of it,  I  ordered a 2 meat plate, I  only ate  about half of it and took the  rest home.  The  owners  are  laidback, they  are only  open  from  11  AM.  to  7 PM  Monday through Saturday.  They  say  8  hours  is enough work  for one day.  I  think  this  shows  quality  is  better  than  quantity.  But  I  wish  they  did  have longer hours.   Family  owned  and  operated,  sit back,  relax  and  enjoy.

data.title: Same o same o
data.text: Always will enjoy good Hawaiian food.  Hate similarities.  Comparison to Honolulu Grill same except Honolulu get more choices.
